summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel A) will convene on May 21, 2024, with a briefing at 10:00 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers at Dallas City Hall and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to review and discuss various applications for variances and exceptions related to zoning regulations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public testimony, and the approval of minutes from the previous meeting. The primary focus will be on the case docket, which includes uncontested items, holdover items, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include several requests for variances and special exceptions concerning side-yard setbacks, single-family regulations, and fence height regulations. Notable applications include:
- BDA234-053 for a side-yard setback variance at 3139 McDermott Avenue.
- BDA234-055 for a special exception to single-family regulations at 3601 W. Lawther Drive.
- BDA234-056 and BDA234-058 for special exceptions to fence height regulations at 8206 Inwood Road and 5717 Walnut Hill Lane, respectively.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is expected to make decisions on the listed applications, including variances and special exceptions. Approval of the minutes from the April 16, 2024 meeting is also on the agenda. Individuals wishing to speak must register by May 20, 2024, to participate in the public hearing.
